data.title: Problematic
data.text: Things started out a bit shaky for our Hilton New Orleans stay.  First off, as we pulled up to the front, the bell guys were talking and just stood there.  We had to exit the car and walk up to them to engage.  Next off, our room was not ready, granted it was 1:30 and check-in was at three.  Next, we were not greeted or thanked for being diamond members, something that always happens.  Reception gave us executive lounge key and we waited and waited and waited.  Finally around 3:30, we went back down to the desk and room still not ready.  Finally at 4, we received our entry card.  The hotel is old but has been renovated and we had a larger corner room.  Safe did not work, no real drawer space. Executive lounge for breakfast was pretty iffy too.  When we arrived, the room was so smoky (burned toast?) that we got choked up.  Food on the hot servers was cold as it was turned off.  Coffee was good.  Long story short, we decided to not stay for the second night.  Better customer service is needed at this Hilton!!!

owner_response.author: shemetoy, Manager at Hilton New Orleans/St. Charles Avenue, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your comments.  We sincerely appreciate all of our guest, especially our Diamond members.  I will share your comments with the staff.  This is not the typical experience at our property.  I will ensure the staff hears your feedback and performs better in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Clean and convenient.
data.text: We stayed here for a long weekend.  Convenient location - can walk everywhere.  Clean and the staff were super friendly.  The club lounge left something to be desired food wise, but there were plenty of snacks, comfy couches and a pool table.

owner_response.author: shemetoy, Manager at Hilton New Orleans/St. Charles Avenue, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for yoru comments.  We are pleased you enjoyed your visit.  I will share your comments with the staff.  Obviously there are some areas that need improvement within the Lounge.  We are making the necessary changes to ensure everyone enjoys their experience.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Underwhelmed
data.text: Maybe I was expecting too much. I have been staying at Hiltons for quite a while. I was locked out of my room each day and what really surprised me the hotel room did not have a single drawer (not even for a bible). There wasn't a pen or notepad by the phone. Service was ok but I would suggest another hotel.

owner_response.author: shemetoy, Manager at Hilton New Orleans/St. Charles Avenue, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for sharing your experience and thank you for being a loyal Hilton guest.  I will share your comments with the hotel design team as well as the hotel operations team.  We always aim to please our guest and we will make the nexessary changes to ensure you are happy in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: New Orleans
data.text: Great trip...hotel was excellent. The staff at the hotel was very helpful...the location of Hotel made it very accessible to go to Burbon street the French Quarter, casino...everything walking distance and if it wasn't walking distance trolley or bus was available with 24 hour passes.

owner_response.author: shemetoy, Manager at Hilton New Orleans/St. Charles Avenue, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for such a great review.  It's true that we are within walking distance and close to most of the attractions New Orleans has to offer.  We look forward to your next visit.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Short Anniversary Trip
data.text: We chose the Hilton for its location, primarily.  We visited the WW II Museum for the fourth time and combined that with a few days away to celebrate our anniversary.    Everyone was helpful and pleasant and made our stay quite nice.

owner_response.author: shemetoy, Manager at Hilton New Orleans/St. Charles Avenue, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are happy you enjoyed your anniversary with us. I'm so glad to see that you enjoyed our location.  I hope you will visit us on your next trip to New Orleans.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice hotel - service could be better
data.text: Was here for a business meeting. We arrived early and checked in, knowing our rooms wouldn't be ready. We walked around the city and had lunch expecting that the rooms would be ready later. After waiting past 3pm (check-in time) ... the rooms were still not ready. The staff really didn't seem to care that about 20 people were in the lobby waiting for a room. There was very little urgency. A few of our guests arrived very late and there were no rooms available (had been booked for months). During our meeting, they decided to paint the door to the meeting room!!! The only door in or out of the room for 50 people needed to be painted during the meeting?! Come on Hilton, you can do better than that. The hotel was beautiful, but the service was lacking.

owner_response.author: shemetoy, Manager at Hilton New Orleans/St. Charles Avenue, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for sharing your experience at our property.  We are pleased you found our property to be a nice place to stay, although I am truly sorry for the problems you experienced with your meeting room and the arrival process.  We experienced a few communication problems during your visit, and are working to improve our processes and communication.  Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience and know that we have addressed your concerns with the staff.  I assure you this is not a typical experience at our property and hope we have the pleasure of welcoming you back for an exceptional stay in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: I love this hotel
data.text: I periodically travel to NOLA for work and this hotel with it's location and accommodations are perfect for my trips. It doesn't hurt that Luke is their attached restaurant. The rooms are all remodeled and the beds are super cozy.

data.title: Weekend visit to watch Football
data.text: Thought the room was great!  Nice and big with plenty of space.  Parking is a little rough.  We did valet or you can pay to park across the street in a public lot.  Executive breakfast was just OK.  Location was great!  Walking distance to the French Quarter as well as the Superdome.  Staff was very friendly and accommodating.

data.title: Loving it in New Orleans
data.text: Awesome place to stay.  It is in walking distance of almost everything in NOLA.  If you can't walk to it, there are so many other ways of getting around. The staff is incredible and very responsive to the guest's needs. I hated to leave.

data.title: Great Experience
data.text:
I booked a trip to visit The Big Easy and had some Hilton Honors points to work with. I booked Hilton St. Charles and I have no regrets about it.  I sifted through reviews and there were definitely mixed reviews but I figured, it was going to be a good trip, regardless.

Check in was a breeze
Nice huge room
Beds & Pillows....Holy Cow, talk about comfortable
Cleanliness, very clean and well kept
Food, we enjoyed Happy Hour at Luke's, the fried oysters are so good.
Bar, stiff and strong drinks....just how I like em.
Hilton Honors breakfast was decent every morning, paired with a good cup of joe.
Staff, extremely kind and helpful

Location...I'm a light sleeper and I did not want to stay right in the thick of things in the French Quarter. This Hilton was just a block away from the madness but it was far enough for me to get a good night sleep. 

Starbucks on the corner, street trolly right outside, the location was perfect for me. Liquor store just a few steps from the hotel.
I'd recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit NOLA....

owner_response.author: shemetoy, Manager at Hilton New Orleans/St. Charles Avenue, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for such a great review.  We are in a great location and our staff is the best.  I will share your comments with the team.  We look forward to your next visit to New Orleans.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Sadly disappointed
data.text: Very disappointing. I had picked this hotel, despite its distance from the quarter, because it is a full-service Hilton. As a diamond member for many years, and gold this year , I know why I cut back on Hilton stays: inconsistent quality between properties. I'm really surprised this property has a Hilton flag. The staff is incredibly friendly and very accommodating. But that's was a pleasure ends . The room itself is claustrophobic small , musty smelling , and just not up to the quality one expects at a Hilton hotel. I attempted to upgrade to a suite, but unfortunately none were available. I I can see why: no one accustomed to quality would stay in such a room. If you're looking for an average Holiday Inn or Comfort Inn , this might be an interesting alternative if you don't mind the musty smell of the room. But if you're looking for a real Hilton experience , I recommend the Marriott two blocks away. This is painfully disappointing and equally painful to have to write such a horrible review of what I expected to be a great property based on a great staff. I regret that I have 2 rooms booked in for the next two nights.

owner_response.author: shemetoy, Manager at Hilton New Orleans/St. Charles Avenue, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Dear Mr. Green, thank you for sharing your experience.  We are pleased to hear the staff meets your expectations.  It appears you are still at the property so please stop by the front desk or call us if their is anything else you may need.  I also see we have moved you to a larger room to better meet your needs.  Our goal is always to exceed our guests expectations.  If there is anything else we can do to improve your visit please inform us.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Oh dear ....
data.text:
I typically really like this Hilton and stay whenever in NOLA but they have messed up one part of their offering hugely, first the good

- staff as friendly as always
- room nice if a little under decorated and plain
- shower, wifi, bed etc good

Now the bad, they have turned the old gym into the exec club which should be great news as a lovely space however they have split it up strangely so it doesn't 'flow' and then hidden the catering at the back.

The breakfast I'm afraid is just plain dreadful, pre cooked rubbery eggs, soggy sausage served on polystyrene plates with plastic silverware, sauce packets and paper coffee cups - this is really not how you should be treating your regular Hilton customers, this is what I expect at a Hilton sub brand or Holiday Inn Express but not here. 

Management please go and experience to see what I mean, a lovely space destroyed with poor quality food served badly ..........

Rob

owner_response.author: shemetoy, Manager at Hilton New Orleans/St. Charles Avenue, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for sharing your experience.  I am pleased our staff and guest room amenities meet your expectations.  I will share your comments with the Executive Lounge staff.  They have already upgraded the serving utensils and plate ware.  We will make the necessary changes in the Executive lounge to ensure they are exceeding the expectations of our loyal guest.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wedding Weekend
data.text: Stayed here for a wedding celebration weekend of a friend. Great location. We could walk almost everywhere. The worst part of the stay was the lukewarm shower. Everything else was lovely. The best part of the stay was Mario, the Head Doorman. He took special care to remember us and help us in every way. Thank you, Mario! You are a treasure.

data.title: Great find
data.text:
Loved my recent stay at this boutique style Hilton.. Very convenient to both the convention center and great French Quarter food,great rooms, personable staff... and Luke restaurant was superb!
Highly recommend.

data.title: Hilton St Joseph St. New Orleans, LA
data.text: The location of this hotel was great it was in walking distance to the French Quarter and other attractions in the area. They are currently doing some upgrades so there is noise in the morning. If you decide to stay here make sure that you stay in a high-level room otherwise you will be hearing a lot of traffic and noise throughout the night.

data.title: Business Trip
data.text: The shower for both days was cold.  The staff was aware of the issue but were nonresponsive.  They said that some rooms on some floors had cold water.  They said someone would come to the room, but the problem was never fixed.  The maintenance staff was supposed to come back to the room, after his remedy to leave the water running for 5 minutes did not work.  No one offered a different room, or any other remedy.  They basically ignored the issue.

owner_response.author: shemetoy, Manager at Hilton New Orleans/St. Charles Avenue, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are so sorry and wish to apologize for the water issue in your guest room, this is certainly not the norm at our property. What is just as upsetting is that we were not able to remedy this challenge for you. I will have the Engineering investigate this problem and correct it for the future.  We thank you for bringing this to our attention and hope to welcome you back for an exceptional stay.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text:
Had a great stay at this Hilton. Room was very modern, clean and comfortable and spacious. The bathroom was particularly spacious with a walk-in shower. My only complaints would be the sliding pocket door to the bathroom and the shower head. The pocket door was extremely squeaky when opened and closed. And the door was relatively heavy to open and close. The rain head shower head was nice but very little water pressure. 
We stayed on the executive level and would do again if returning, great breakfast. Would make this Hilton a stop again if back in NOLA.

data.title: A restful business trip
data.text: My morning would start with a great workout in a very large gym with a variety of equipment including yoga balls, poles, mats, free weights and large TVs.  The front desk staff were friendly and helpful.  The bellmen greeted me with a hello and big smile as the opened the door for as I exited or entered the hotel.  Restaurant was convenient and very good.

data.title: Best Hotel Ever!!!! Spacious, clean, contemporary, convenient and the staff is very friendly!
data.text: Best Hotel Ever!!!! Spacious, clean, contemporary, convenient and luxurious the staff is very friendly! The only issue I had was with parking. Only valet parking is available and is very pricey (47.00 a night), other than that I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family!😊

data.title: Nice Location and a Boutique Feel
data.text: This hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of nearly everything. I walked to the WWII Museum in about 15 minutes and it's less than 10 minutes walk to the French Quarter. The staff is very friendly, and it has one of the nicer fitness centers for a hotel. The restaurant in the hotel is a top NOLA restaurant by chef John Besh and had a vibrant happy hour and amazing food!

owner_response.author: shemetoy, Manager at Hilton New Orleans/St. Charles Avenue, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the wonderful comments regarding your recent visit. I will share your comments with the staff. Please come back and see us in the near future so may provide another great experience!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
